title: CALL Answered, Message Received
body_text:
BACKGROUND INFORMATION
CALL OF DUTY
was the "Friday The 13th" collision between long-standing rival squads
WALL
and
ALL
. The 2007 "Rivalry of the Year" re-emerged for the first time since
Thanksgiving Weekend 2010
.
It was the 191st event within the
Tronolone Era
and just the 15th Friday outing compared to a whopping 170 Saturday and just six Sunday. The Wall High School rear tennis courts played host from 5:30pm to 10:00pm.
Though only few drops were felt, CALL OF DUTY was also "Wet War XXXVII".
MAIN ATTRACTION: WALL v. ALL 12
The predominant attraction of CALL OF DUTY was the pride-filled encounter pitting the hometown warriors WALL against the visiting invaders ALL. The division of individual soldiers was based strictly on the high school graduated, currently attended, or will attend.
Initially, it looked as if ALL would march towards victory after the opening contest. Indeed the overwhelming stature possible reason for the immediate success. Eight grueling rounds later, ALL failed to claim another win regardless of classic two-team or Prison Ball rules in effect.
Why the collapse? WALL remained consistent in both strategy and army size, and certainly enough to force the early departures of some of their most battle-tested adversaries.
WALL soundly defeated ALL, 8 - 1, at CALL OF DUTY. It was the largest margin of victory in the well-documented history of
WALL v. ALL
.
DETAILED ARMY NOTES
Team ALL's coalition was both great in numbers and diversity, with Manasquan's "Big Blue Warriors" representing much of the group population.
→ Estavam Ferri: Lima
→ Manasquan: Bergquist, Buckley, Londono, McCrorey, Megill, Oberto, Rich, Stopa, Yochum
→ Maranatha Christian Acadamy*: Switzer
→ Monmouth Regional: Tronolone
→ Ocean Township: Edwards
→ Pennington: D'Luhy
→ Shore Regional: Porowski, Spengeman
→ Wallenpanpack^: Whitman
*New school representation in Hazlet, New Jersey.
^New school representation in Hawley, Pennsylvania.
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
One fascinating note about this most recent incarnation of WALL was that each combatant had headlined at least one season finale [or equivalent] extravaganza, collectively racking up an astounding 21 appearances. Here's the comprehensive list: Steve Adams
(X, 50)
→ Justin Pierce*
(90, 100)
→ Travis Mills
(XL, 150)
→ Chris Adams*
(50, 70, C30)
→ Kevin Adams*
(X, 50, 100)
→ Tom Adams
(50, 90)
→ Kevin Fitzpatrick*
(70, 100)
→ Zach Katz
(FAMILY AFFAIR V)
→ Justin Wolf*
(CXL | FAMILY AFFAIR I, FAMILY AFFAIR V)
→ Sascha Basista
(FAMILY AFFAIR III)
→ Michelle Mullins
(C70)
.
Contrary to the opposition, the mass in numbers for the ALL Army did not equate to as much big match experience. Only a handful of the total 17 soldiers had such: John Tronolone*
(20, 30, LX, 100)
→ Kevin Megill*
(30, 80, C30)
→ Dan Spengeman
(LX)
→ Lauren Stopa*
(150)
→ Michael Edwards*
(80, 100)
→ Juan Londono
(CXL | FAMILY AFFAIR I, 150)
→ Jon Yochum
(FAMILY AFFAIR II)
.
* = denotes member of the
ECDElite
Hall of Fame. Notice this ratio also favored WALL, 5 to 4.
STATISTICAL SIGNIFICANCE
The 12th WALL v. ALL encounter attracted
twenty-eight (28) participants
; the highest attendance since
ECD's
5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY
in September 2010! A relatively high female count was recorded making up 10 of the total turnout, 9 of which represented Team ALL.
The
three new players
were members of Team ALL: Charlie Whitman, Victoria Porowski, and Emma Switzer.
ECD's
ever-increasing player count has reached 493 .. who will be player #500? The
ECD
Nation may just find out in the coming months.
body_html:
• BACKGROUND INFORMATION
    CALL OF DUTY was the "Friday The 13th" collision between long-standing rival squads WALL and ALL. The 2007 "Rivalry of the Year" re-emerged for the first time since Thanksgiving Weekend 2010.

    It was the 191st event within the Tronolone Era and just the 15th Friday outing compared to a whopping 170 Saturday and just six Sunday. The Wall High School rear tennis courts played host from 5:30pm to 10:00pm.

    Though only few drops were felt, CALL OF DUTY was also "Wet War XXXVII".

  • MAIN ATTRACTION: WALL v. ALL 12
    The predominant attraction of CALL OF DUTY was the pride-filled encounter pitting the hometown warriors WALL against the visiting invaders ALL. The division of individual soldiers was based strictly on the high school graduated, currently attended, or will attend.

    Initially, it looked as if ALL would march towards victory after the opening contest. Indeed the overwhelming stature possible reason for the immediate success. Eight grueling rounds later, ALL failed to claim another win regardless of classic two-team or Prison Ball rules in effect.

    Why the collapse? WALL remained consistent in both strategy and army size, and certainly enough to force the early departures of some of their most battle-tested adversaries.

    WALL soundly defeated ALL, 8 - 1, at CALL OF DUTY. It was the largest margin of victory in the well-documented history of WALL v. ALL.

  • DETAILED ARMY NOTES
    Team ALL's coalition was both great in numbers and diversity, with Manasquan's "Big Blue Warriors" representing much of the group population.
    → Estavam Ferri: Lima
    → Manasquan: Bergquist, Buckley, Londono, McCrorey, Megill, Oberto, Rich, Stopa, Yochum
    → Maranatha Christian Acadamy*: Switzer
    → Monmouth Regional: Tronolone
    → Ocean Township: Edwards
    → Pennington: D'Luhy
    → Shore Regional: Porowski, Spengeman
    → Wallenpanpack^: Whitman
    *New school representation in Hazlet, New Jersey.
    ^New school representation in Hawley, Pennsylvania.

    ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
    One fascinating note about this most recent incarnation of WALL was that each combatant had headlined at least one season finale [or equivalent] extravaganza, collectively racking up an astounding 21 appearances. Here's the comprehensive list: Steve Adams (X, 50) → Justin Pierce* (90, 100) → Travis Mills (XL, 150) → Chris Adams* (50, 70, C30) → Kevin Adams* (X, 50, 100) → Tom Adams (50, 90) → Kevin Fitzpatrick* (70, 100) → Zach Katz (FAMILY AFFAIR V) → Justin Wolf* (CXL | FAMILY AFFAIR I, FAMILY AFFAIR V) → Sascha Basista (FAMILY AFFAIR III) → Michelle Mullins (C70).

    Contrary to the opposition, the mass in numbers for the ALL Army did not equate to as much big match experience. Only a handful of the total 17 soldiers had such: John Tronolone* (20, 30, LX, 100) → Kevin Megill* (30, 80, C30) → Dan Spengeman (LX) → Lauren Stopa* (150) → Michael Edwards* (80, 100) → Juan Londono (CXL | FAMILY AFFAIR I, 150) → Jon Yochum (FAMILY AFFAIR II).

    * = denotes member of the ECDElite Hall of Fame. Notice this ratio also favored WALL, 5 to 4.

  • STATISTICAL SIGNIFICANCE
    The 12th WALL v. ALL encounter attracted twenty-eight (28) participants; the highest attendance since ECD's 5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY in September 2010! A relatively high female count was recorded making up 10 of the total turnout, 9 of which represented Team ALL.

    The three new players were members of Team ALL: Charlie Whitman, Victoria Porowski, and Emma Switzer. ECD's ever-increasing player count has reached 493 .. who will be player #500? The ECD Nation may just find out in the coming months.
